程序缺陷、臭虫，电脑系统或者程序中存在的任何一种破坏正常运转能力的问题或者缺陷，都可以叫做“bug”
Benguela, Angola 安哥拉
bugler 号兵
Brooklyn Union Gas (company) <美国>布鲁克林联合煤气（公司）
bulbourethral gland 尿道球腺

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"虫，昆虫"之意。
means: bug ： 指小昆虫，尤指吸血的臭虫，也可指细菌。
insect ： 含义广泛，多指蚂蚁、黄蜂、蝉等等。
pest ： 指有害的昆虫或有害的小动物。
worm ： 侧重指蚯蚓、蚕、毛虫等小而无骨的虫。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都含"致病的微生物"之意。
means: germ ： 微生物的俗称，专指引起人体生命的病菌。
bacteria(系bacterium的复数形式)，泛指任何在动植物体中广泛传播的微生物细菌，其中有的对生命体无害，有的能导致传染病或严重疾病，如天花、霍乱等。
virus ： 技术用语，特指病毒或过滤性病原体。
microbe ： 本义指在显微镜下才能见到的微生物，现在多指引起疾病的细菌。
bug ： 非正式用词，指细菌或由病毒所引起的传染病。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"偷听，窃听"之意。
means: overhear ： 多指在别人不注意或不知道的情况下偶然听到谈话的内容。
bug ： 指在室内等处安装窃听器以窃听他人的谈话内容。
monitor ： 通常指用仪器设备偷听别人的谈话内容。

word_mean: 昆虫：半翅目(Hemiptera)的一种昆虫

sentence.Network_en: He heard that they were planning to bug his office.
sentence.Network_cn: 他得知他们打算在他办公室安装窃听器。

sentence.Network_en: Don't bug private conversations, and don't buy papers that reprint them.
sentence.Network_cn: 不要窃听私人谈话，不要购买重印这些谈话的报纸。

sentence.Network_en: There was a bug going around at the club.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个俱乐部流行着一种轻微的传染病。

jx.jx_en_mean: To leave someone alone; go away.
To leave or quit, usually in a hurry.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 匆忙离开：离开或停止，多是匆忙地

jx.jx_en_mean: To avoid a responsibility or duty. Often used with&I{on}  or &I{of}
jx.jx_cn_mean: 逃避：逃避责任或义务，常与&I{on} 或 &I{of} 连用

lj.lj_ly: bugged out on his partners at the first sign of trouble.
lj.lj_ls: 在第一次遇到麻烦时他就离开了同伴

phrase.cizu_name: bug out N. Amer. informal 北美，非正式

lj.lj_ly: if you see enemy troops, bug out.
lj.lj_ls: 如看见敌军，你们就迅速撤退。

lj.lj_ly: men's eyes bug out when she walks past.
lj.lj_ls: 当她路过时，男人们的眼珠子都鼓出来了。

jx.jx_en_mean: To impart useful information to (another) in a subtle, discreet way.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 事先给某人暗示：用隐秘的、谨慎的方式将有用的信息告诉他人

phrase.cizu_name: put a bug in (someone's) ear【非正式用语】

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: of unknown origin. Current verb senses date from the early 20th cent

encyclopedia.content: 英文单词，本意是臭虫、缺陷、损坏等意思。现在人们将在电脑系统或程序中，隐藏着的一些未被发现的缺陷或问题统称为bug（漏洞）。

entry.def: A bug is an insect or similar small creature.

example.ex: We noticed tiny bugs that were all over the walls.
example.tran: 我们注意到墙上爬满了小虫子。

example.ex: ...a bloodsucking bug which infests poor housing.
example.tran: 贫民区滋生的一种吸血的虫子

entry.def: A bug is an illness which is caused by small organisms such as bacteria.

example.ex: I think I've got a bit of a stomach bug...
example.tran: 我想我的胃可能出了点儿毛病。

example.ex: There was a bug going around at the club.
example.tran: 这个俱乐部流行着一种轻微的传染病。

entry.tran: （计算机程序中的）漏洞，错误，故障
entry.def: If there is a bug in a computer program, there is a mistake in it.

example.ex: There is a bug in the software.

entry.def: A bug is a tiny hidden microphone which transmits what people are saying.

example.ex: There was a bug on the phone.

entry.def: If someone bugs a place, they hide tiny microphones in it which transmit what people are saying.

example.ex: He heard that they were planning to bug his office...
example.tran: 他得知他们打算在他办公室安装窃听器。

example.ex: I found out my phone was bugged.
example.tran: 我发现我的电话被窃听了。

entry.def: You can say that someone has been bitten by a particular bug when they suddenly become very enthusiastic about something.

example.ex: I've definitely been bitten by the gardening bug...
Roundhay Park in Leeds was the place I first got the fishing bug.
example.tran: 利兹市的朗德海公园是我首次对钓鱼着迷的地方。

entry.def: If someone or something bugs you, they worry or annoy you.

example.ex: I only did it to bug my parents.
example.tran: 我这么做只是为了让我父母心烦。

means.word_mean: 1. general term for any insect or similar creeping or crawling invertebrate
2. a fault or defect in a system or machine
3. a small hidden microphone; for listening secretly
4. insects with sucking mouthparts and forewings thickened and leathery at the base; usually show incomplete metamorphosis
5. a minute life form (especially a disease-causing bacterium); the term is not in technical use

sentences.sentence: "The children teased the boy because of his stammer"

means.word_mean: 2. tap a telephone or telegraph wire to get information;

sentences.sentence: "The FBI was tapping the phone line of the suspected spy"

example.en: I gotta find a way to bug out of here without getting caught.
example.zh: 我得想个办法赶快逃离此地，免得被人逮住。

example.en: Orders are to bug out by one hundred miles.
example.zh: 下达的命令是后退 100英里。
退出北大两洋公约组织

sentences.cn: 一袋袋的米里长满了虫子。

means.word_mean: 病菌; 轻微的传染病; 小病

sentences.en: I'm not feeling well, I must have picked up a bug somewhere.
sentences.cn: 我感觉不舒服, 一定是在什么地方感染病菌了。

means.word_mean: (机器等)故障; 程序错误, 缺陷

sentences.en: There is a bug in the system.
The police searched the courtroom for bugs.
sentences.cn: 警方检查法庭, 看有没有窃听器。

sentences.en: The police have bugged his office.
sentences.cn: 警察在他的办公室装了窃听器。

sentences.en: Her eyes bugged out of her head.
